Release Notes

storybooks/storybook
v5.0.3
Compare Source
Bug Fixes

Accessibility: Add missing button titles (#‚Äã6124)

Maintenance

UI: Make update notifications much less aggressive (#‚Äã6143)

v5.0.2
Compare Source
Features

CLI: Add --debug-webpack option (#‚Äã6082)

Bug Fixes

Addon-a11y: Fix design icons (#‚Äã5991)
Addon-cssresources: Fix STORY_RENDERED CSS reset (#‚Äã6050)
CLI: Clear build folder in static build (#‚Äã6024)
Addon-backgrounds: Set preview to theme color when "transparent" (#‚Äã6042)
UI: Fix search item in menu (#‚Äã6027)
Addon-knobs: Fix key press debouncing (#‚Äã6022)
CLI: Fix welcome component in dark theme (#‚Äã5998)
Addon-viewport: Fix viewport iframe dimensions (#‚Äã5993)
Core: fix selectStory with one parameter (#‚Äã5983)

Maintenance

Addon-viewport: Change styling to more closely match v4 (#‚Äã5979)

v5.0.1
Compare Source
Bug Fixes

Core: Remove custom presets warning (#‚Äã5911)
Core: support unicode chars in story IDs (#‚Äã5964)
Core: Add core-js dependencies where it was missing (#‚Äã5961)
CLI: Fix missing iframe.html in absolute path output directory(#‚Äã5947)
Addon-knobs: Added debouncing between keystrokes to speed up component rendering (#‚Äã5811)
UI: Fix search in production mode (#‚Äã5909)

v5.0.0
Compare Source
Storybook 5.0 is a completely new UI with the following improvements:

üåì New design with light and dark themes
üõ† Canvas toolbar for easy access to addons
üó∫ Overhauled navigation sidebar with an intuitive menu
üóú Redesigned addons panel with handy buttons to toggle visibility and orientation
‚å®Ô∏è Improved keyboard shortcuts that are user configurable
üåç New URL structure that eliminates long strings of query parameters

5.0 contains hundreds more fixes, features, and tweaks. Browse the changelogs matching 5.0.0-alpha.*, 5.0.0-beta.*, and 5.0.0-rc.* for the full list of changes. See MIGRATION.md to ugprade from 4.x.
v4.1.14
Compare Source
Dependency Upgrades

React-native: Fix RN 0.58.5 / support 0.59 via react-native-modal-datetime-picker 6.0.0 (#‚Äã4425)



webpack-contrib/css-loader
v2.1.1
Compare Source
Bug Fixes

do not break selector with escaping (#‚Äã896) (0ba8c66)
source map generation when sourceRoot is present (#‚Äã901) (e9ce745)
sourcemap generating when previous loader pass sourcemap as string (#‚Äã905) (3797e4d)



cypress-io/cypress
v3.2.0
Compare Source
Released 3/15/2019
Features:

cy.visit() has been expanded to allow options url, method, body, and headers. This allows cy.visit() to be called with a POST method or with headers like Accept-Language or Authorization. Fixes #‚Äã1500, #‚Äã1904 and #‚Äã908.
cy.request() now allows any valid HTTP method to be used including TRACE, COPY, LOCK, MKCOL, MOVE, PURGE, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, UNLOCK, REPORT, MKACTIVITY, CHECKOUT, MERGE, M-SEARCH, NOTIFY, SUBSCRIBE, UNSUBSCRIBE, SEARCH, and CONNECT. Addresses #‚Äã1302
The --browser argument of the Command Line and the browser argument of the Module API have been updated to allow passing a <path>. Addresses #‚Äã1026.
cy.type() now accepts {home} and {end} special character sequences to move the cursor to the start or end of a line. Addresses #‚Äã2033.
The Cypress Chrome extension now has a static ID of caljajdfkjjjdehjdoimjkkakekklcck. This allows Cypress to be added to extension whitelists for those working under corporate policies that prohibit extensions. Addresses #‚Äã3673, #‚Äã1239 and #‚Äã2494.

Bugfixes:

Problems logging in through GitHub in the Test Runner have been fixed. The GitHub login window no longer shows the browser support banner and the "Authorize cypress-io" button is no longer disabled. Fixes #‚Äã1251.
Fixed an issue when testing applications using older versions of jQuery. They now no longer throw item.first is not a function. Fixes #‚Äã2927.
Cypress now detects more instances of browser installations. Fixes #‚Äã3183 and #‚Äã3218.
Fixed issue with loading fixture files containing more than one . in their filename while not specifying the file extension. We are also displaying a clearer warning when a fixture file cannot be found. Fixes #‚Äã1402.
All third party @types have been moved from Cypress dependencies into devDependencies. This should fix situations where user's type dependencies were conflicting with Cypress's third party type definitions. Fixes #‚Äã3371 and #‚Äã1227.
Cypress.config('baseUrl') has been updated to no longer strip singular / at the end of urls and instead only strip instances of multiple /. Fixes #‚Äã3540.
The prompt to "Restore pages?" is no longer displayed within Chrome upon restarting a crashed Chrome window. Addresses #‚Äã2048.
cy.wrap() no longer throws an error when a non-jQuery wrapped DOM element is passed in as an argument. Fixes #‚Äã3549.
Fixed issue where all arguments passed to setTimeout or setInterval were not properly passed on to the target function. Fixes #‚Äã3592.
.filter() has been updated so that when called with a function, the options are now properly read. Fixes #‚Äã3315.
Cypress's recognition of websites attempting framebusting has been updated to include framebusting code wrapped within (). #‚Äã3267
When .its() returns undefined it no longer errors. It will now follow the same logic as all other commands and only fail when directly by a .should() command with an assertion that is not met. Fixes #‚Äã1531.
When cy.wrap() is followed directly by a .should() command, cy.wrap() will now retry when its argument evaluates to undefined until it meets the requirements of the assertion or the cy.wrap() command times out. Fixes #‚Äã3241.

Misc:

We now display a warning when passing an argument to --spec that is not surrounded by quotes "" recommending that the argument instead be surrounded by quotes. In some cases, not providing quotes can cause the arguments to be read in a way that is likely not its intended use. Addresses #‚Äã3318 and #‚Äã2298.
The number of logs printed when installing Cypress in docker has been reduced. Partially addresses #‚Äã1243.
The seeded Kitchen Sink examples have some new examples showing how to add a message to assertions, how to compare the text content of two elements, and how to make assertions about data attributes. The examples also have some small typo fixes. Fixes #‚Äã502. Addressed in #‚Äã3272, #‚Äã3287, and #‚Äã3700.
We now only mount internal servers on loopback. Addresses #‚Äã3712.
The instructions in Cypress's update window now include yarn update instructions alongside npm. Addresses #‚Äã2871.
The spec file's font weight has been increased within the Test Runner for better readability. Addressed in #‚Äã3065.
We improved the error message displayed when a record key is unrecognized during cypress run. Addresses #‚Äã1449.
We improved the typings when using Cypress.on to listen for window.alert events to allow for Sinon.stub. Fixes #‚Äã3451.
Fixed typo in typing for .trigger options. Addressed in #‚Äã3588.

Documentation Changes:

New Retryability doc #‚Äã1278
Updated --browser and browser args to accept path #‚Äã1419
cypress-io/cypress-documentation#‚Äã1474 %}
Updated docs on explain how to run Chrome and Chromium browsers #‚Äã1339
Added {home} and {end} character sequences to {% url "cy.type()" type } doc. Also wrote better description of what {downarrow} and {uparrow} character sequences actually do. #‚Äã1347
Added all newly supported HTTP methods to cy.request() doc.
Add new section to Debugging doc explaining whitelisting the Cypress Chrome extension.
Fixed code example for google analytics stubbing #‚Äã1454

Dependency Updates

Upgraded @cypress/commit-info from 2.1.1 to 2.1.2. #‚Äã3327.
Upgraded @cypress/xvfb from 1.2.3 to 1.2.4. #‚Äã3328.
Upgraded @ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg from 1.0.15 to 1.0.17. #‚Äã3329.
Upgraded cachedir from 1.3.0 to 2.1.0. #‚Äã3660.
Upgraded chalk from 2.4.1 to 2.4.2. #‚Äã3362.
Upgraded chokidar from 1.6.0 to 1.7.0. #‚Äã3363.
Upgraded coffee-script from 1.12.5 to 1.12.7. #‚Äã3365.
Upgraded commander from 2.11.0 to 2.19.0. #‚Äã3366.
Upgraded common-tags from 1.4.0 to 1.8.0. #‚Äã3368.
Upgraded compression from 1.7.2 to 1.7.3. #‚Äã3379.
Upgraded cookie from 0.2.4 to 0.3.1. #‚Äã3380.
Upgraded cookie-parser from 1.4.3 to 1.4.4. #‚Äã3443.
Upgraded dependency-tree from 6.4.0 to 6.5.0. #‚Äã3381.
Upgraded electron-context-menu from 0.8.0 to 0.11.0. #‚Äã3383.
Upgraded electron-packager from 9.0.1 to 9.1.0. #‚Äã3384.
Upgraded electron-positioner from 3.0.0 to 3.0.1. #‚Äã3385.
Upgraded errorhandler from 1.1.1 to 1.5.0. #‚Äã3386.
Upgraded express from 4.16.2 to 4.16.4. #‚Äã3409.
Upgraded extract-zip from 1.6.6 to 1.6.7. #‚Äã3410.
Upgraded glob from 7.1.2 to 7.1.3. #‚Äã3412.
Upgraded image-size from 0.5.5 to 0.7.2. #‚Äã3413 and #‚Äã3500.
Upgraded is-ci from 1.0.10 to 1.2.1. #‚Äã3414.
Upgraded lodash from 4.17.4 to 4.17.11. #‚Äã3344.
Upgraded mocha-junit-reporter from 1.17.0 to 1.18.0. #‚Äã3417.
Upgraded moment from 2.23.0 to 2.24.0. #‚Äã3433.
Upgraded morgan from 1.3.0 to 1.9.1. #‚Äã3434.
Upgraded node-uuid from 1.4.1 to 1.4.8. #‚Äã3436.
Upgraded parse-domain from 2.0.0 to 2.1.7. #‚Äã3437.
Upgraded request from 2.87.0 to 2.88.0. #‚Äã3444.
Upgraded request-progress from 0.3.1 to 0.4.0. #‚Äã3445.
Upgraded request-promise from 4.1.1 to 4.2.4. #‚Äã3446 and #‚Äã3476.
Upgraded return-deep-diff from 0.2.9 to 0.3.0. #‚Äã3447.
Upgraded send from 0.14.2 to 0.16.2. #‚Äã3448.
Upgraded ssl-root-cas from 1.2.5 to 1.3.1. #‚Äã3449.
Upgraded supports-color from 5.1.0 to 5.5.0. #‚Äã3464.
Upgraded through from 2.3.6 to 2.3.8. #‚Äã3465.
Upgraded tmp from 0.0.31 to 0.0.33. #‚Äã3466.
Upgraded tough-cookie from 2.4.3 to 3.0.1. #‚Äã3477 and #‚Äã3659.
Upgraded trash from 4.0.0 to 4.3.0. #‚Äã3478.
Upgraded underscore.string from 3.3.4 to 3.3.5. #‚Äã3480.
Upgraded yauzl from 2.8.0 to 2.10.0. #‚Äã3481. Potentially fixes #‚Äã3515.
We also updated many dependencies used for development and removed some unused dependencies.



npm/cli
v6.9.0
Compare Source
FEATURES

2ba3a0f67 #‚Äã90 Time traveling installs using the --before flag. (@‚Äãzkat)
b7b54f2d1 #‚Äã3 Add support for package aliases. This allows packages to be installed under a different directory than the package name listed in package.json, and adds a new dependency type to allow this to be done for registry dependencies. (@‚Äãzkat)
684bccf06 #‚Äã146 Always save package-lock.json when using --package-lock-only. (@‚Äãaeschright)
b8b8afd40 #‚Äã139 Make empty-string run-scripts run successfully as a no-op. (@‚Äãvlasy)
8047b19b1 npm.community#‚Äã3784 Match git semver ranges when flattening the tree. (@‚Äãlarsgw)
e135c2bb3 npm.community#‚Äã1725 Re-enable updating local packages. (@‚Äãlarsgw)

BUGFIXES

cf09fbaed #‚Äã153 Set modified to undefined in npm view when time is not available. This fixes a bug where npm view would crash on certain third-party registries. (@‚Äãsimonua)
774fc26ee #‚Äã154 Print out tar version in install.sh only when the flag is supported not all the tar implementations support --version flag. This allows the install script to work in OpenBSD, for example. (@‚Äãagudulin)
863baff11 #‚Äã158 Fix typo in error message for npm stars. (@‚Äãphihag)
a805a95ad npm.community#‚Äã4227 Strip version info from pkg on E404. This improves the error messaging format. (@‚Äãlarsgw)

DOCS

5d7633833 #‚Äã160 Add npm add as alias to npm install in docs. (@‚Äãahasall)
489c2211c #‚Äã162 Fix link to RFC #‚Äã10 in the changelog. (@‚Äãmansona)
433020ead #‚Äã135 Describe exit codes in npm-audit docs. (@‚Äãemilis-tm)

DEPENDENCIES

ee6b6746b zkat/make-fetch-happen#‚Äã29 agent-base@4.2.1 (@‚ÄãTooTallNate)
2ce23baf5 lock-verify@2.1.0: Adds support for package aliases (@‚Äãzkat)
baaedbc6e pacote@9.5.0: Adds opts.before support (@‚Äãzkat)
57e771a03 #‚Äã164 licensee@6.1.0 (@‚Äãkemitchell)
2b78288d4 add core to default inclusion tests in pack (@‚Äãzkat)
9b8b6513f npm.community#‚Äã5382 npm-packlist@1.4.1: Fixes bug where core/ directories were being suddenly excluded. (@‚Äãzkat)



facebook/react
v16.8.4
Compare Source
React DOM and other renderers

Fix a bug where DevTools caused a runtime error when inspecting a component that used a useContext hook. (@‚Äãbvaughn in #‚Äã14940)



reactjs/react-docgen
v4.1.0
Compare Source
New Features

Support all the config resolving related babel options (#‚Äã334)
This allows the new options envName, babelrc, root, rootMode, configFile and babelrcRoots in the programatic API. To see what this options do head over to the babel documentation

Thanks @‚Äãjquense.


palantir/tslint
v5.14.0
Compare Source

[bugfix] backtick option for quotemark rule no longer incorrectly flags string literals that must use single/double quotes (#‚Äã4535)
[bugfix] Fixed regression in CheckstyleFormatter backwards compatibility (#‚Äã4561)
[bugfix]whitespace rule now lints export statements (#‚Äã4554)
[bugfix]no-trailing-whitespace no longer flags files starting with a byte order mark (#‚Äã4543)
[enhancement]promise-function-async now allows single statement lamda functions that delegate to another promise-returning function (#‚Äã4553)
[enhancement] Add note to docs about zero-indexing for machine formatters (#‚Äã4544)
[enhancement] Fix metadata of the whitespace rule (#‚Äã4551)
[enhancement] Add junit output for files which are successfully linted (#‚Äã4566)
[new-rule-option] underscore option for no-shadowed-variable rule to ignore shadowed underscores (#‚Äã4546)
[new-rule-option] require-const-for-all-caps option for variable-name rule (#‚Äã2936)
[new-rule-option] overloads option for completed-docs rule to enforce documentation of each overload signature (#‚Äã4563)
[new-rule-option] allow-namespace-imports option for no-duplicate-imports rule (#‚Äã4524)
[new-rule-option] allow-arguments option for no-object-literal-type-assertion rule to allow type assertions on object literals used inside call expressions (#‚Äã4521)
[new-rule-option] allow-delete option for no-unbound-method rule (#‚Äã4548)
[new-rule]no-tautology-expression (#‚Äã4470)
[new-rule]static-this (#‚Äã4475)
[new-rule]unnecessary-else (#‚Äã4502)

webpack/webpack
v4.29.6
Compare Source
Bugfixes

typeof __webpack_require__ and require.onError is no longer evaluated to undefined and evaluation is done at runtime instead.
this value in module.hot.accept with imported dependency is correctly preserved.
webassemblyjs updated to latest version

Contributing

added a linting step to ensure all dependencies resolve to npm modules

Renovate configuration
üìÖ Schedule: "before 2am" (UTC).
üö¶ Automerge: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.
‚ôªÔ∏è Rebasing: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or if you modify the PR title to begin with "rebase!".
üëª Immortal: This PR will be recreated if closed unmerged. Get config help if that's undesired.


 If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box


This PR has been generated by Renovate Bot. View repository job log here.
